parameters.name: FW_T_TIME_CONST
parameters.longDesc: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameters.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameters.name: FD_ESCS_EN
parameters.shortDesc:
Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state.
If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state.
Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle

parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_EN
parameters.shortDesc:
Enable PWM input on AUX5 or MAIN5 (depending on board) for engaging failsafe from an external
automatic trigger system (ATS)
parameters.longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG
parameters.shortDesc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
parameters.longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameters.longDesc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: NAV_FT_DST
parameters.longDesc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameters.name: NAV_FT_FS
parameters.longDesc: The side to follow the target from (front right = 0, behind = 1, front = 2, front left = 3)

parameters.name: NAV_FT_RS
parameters.shortDesc:
Dynamic filtering algorithm responsiveness to target movement
lower numbers increase the responsiveness to changing long lat
but also ignore less noise

parameters.name: NAV_MIN_FT_HT
parameters.longDesc: The minimum height in meters relative to home for following a target

parameters.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameters.shortDesc: Dump GPS communication to a file
parameters.longDesc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message.

parameters.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameters.longDesc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameters.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameters.shortDesc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameters.longDesc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. (currently only for the Trimble MB-Two). Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the first antenna is in front. The offset angle increases counterclockwise. Set this to 90 if the first antenna is placed on the right side and the second on the left side of the vehicle.

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_LT
parameters.longDesc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it goes into flight termination. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_R
parameters.longDesc: Roll in degrees during the loiter

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_TR
parameters.longDesc: Thrust value which is set during the open loop loiter

parameters.name: GF_ACTION
parameters.longDesc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence. Due to the inherent danger of this, this function is disabled using a software circuit breaker, which needs to be reset to 0 to really shut down the system.

parameters.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameters.longDesc: Select which altitude reference should be used 0 = WGS84, 1 = AMSL

parameters.name: GF_COUNT
parameters.longDesc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameters.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_SOURCE
parameters.longDesc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameters.name: HTE_ACC_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_ERR_INIT
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_NOISE
parameters.longDesc: Reduce to make the hover thrust estimate more stable, increase if the real hover thrust is expected to change quickly over time.

parameters.name: LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameters.name: LNDFW_XYACC_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state (m/s^2)

parameters.name: LNDMC_ALT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.

parameters.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.

parameters.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_HI
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_LO
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LTEST_ACC_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection

parameters.name: LTEST_MEAS_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values results in less agressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.

parameters.name: LTEST_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving:     The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.

parameters.name: LTEST_POS_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction

parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_X
parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
parameters.longDesc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
parameters.longDesc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.name: LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y direction

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz)

parameters.name: LPE_BAR_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation

parameters.name: LPE_EPH_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization

parameters.name: LPE_EPV_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization

parameters.name: LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN
parameters.shortDesc:
Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)
by initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable

parameters.name: LPE_FGYRO_HP
parameters.shortDesc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency

parameters.name: LPE_FLW_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow z offset from center

parameters.name: LPE_FLW_RR
parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain

parameters.name: LPE_FUSION
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)

bitmask.description: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_VXY
parameters.shortDesc:
GPS xy velocity standard deviation.
EPV used if greater than this value

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_XY
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater

parameters.name: LPE_LAND_VXY
parameters.shortDesc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation

parameters.name: LPE_LAT
parameters.shortDesc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS

parameters.name: LPE_LDR_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameters.name: LPE_LON
parameters.shortDesc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS

parameters.name: LPE_LT_COV
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater

parameters.name: LPE_PN_P
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.name: LPE_PN_T
parameters.shortDesc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)

parameters.name: LPE_PN_V
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.name: LPE_SNR_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameters.name: LPE_T_MAX_GRADE
parameters.shortDesc:
Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)
Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement

parameters.name: LPE_VIS_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps

parameters.name: LPE_VXY_PUB
parameters.shortDesc: Required velocity xy standard deviation to publish position

parameters.name: LPE_Z_PUB
parameters.shortDesc: Required z standard deviation to publish altitude/ terrain

parameters.name: MAV_0_FORWARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 0
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameters.name: MAV_0_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameters.name: MAV_0_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 0
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

parameters.name: MAV_0_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 0
parameters.longDesc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_1_FORWARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 1
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameters.name: MAV_1_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameters.name: MAV_1_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 1
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

parameters.name: MAV_1_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 1
parameters.longDesc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_2_FORWARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 2
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameters.name: MAV_2_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameters.name: MAV_2_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 2
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

parameters.name: MAV_2_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 2
parameters.longDesc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_BROADCAST
parameters.longDesc: This allows a ground control station to automatically find the drone on the local network.

parameters.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameters.name: MAV_HASH_CHK_EN
parameters.longDesc: Disabling the parameter hash check functionality will make the mavlink instance stream parameters continuously.

parameters.name: MAV_HB_FORW_EN
parameters.longDesc: The mavlink hearbeat message will not be forwarded if this parameter is set to 'disabled'. The main reason for disabling heartbeats to be forwarded is because they confuse dronekit.

parameters.name: MAV_ODOM_LP
parameters.longDesc: If set, it gets the data from 'vehicle_visual_odometry' instead of 'vehicle_odometry' serving as a loopback of the received ODOMETRY messages on the Mavlink receiver.

values.description: Default to 1, switch to 2 if GCS sends version 2

parameters.name: MAV_RADIO_TOUT
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout in seconds for the RADIO_STATUS reports coming in
parameters.longDesc: If the connected radio stops reporting RADIO_STATUS for a certain time, a warning is triggered and, if MAV_X_RADIO_CTL is enabled, the software-flow control is reset.

parameters.name: MAV_SIK_RADIO_ID
parameters.longDesc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the SiK radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults. Only applies if this mavlink instance is going through a SiK radio

values.description: Operator control unit / ground control station
Two-rotor VTOL using control surfaces in vertical operation in addition. Tailsitter.
Quad-rotor VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Tailsitter.

parameters.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameters.shortDesc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.

parameters.name: COM_TAKEOFF_ACT
parameters.shortDesc: Action after TAKEOFF has been accepted
parameters.longDesc: The mode transition after TAKEOFF has completed successfully.

parameters.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameters.shortDesc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
parameters.longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIS_1WP from the home position.

parameters.name: MIS_DIST_WPS
parameters.longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running missions which are way too big. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if any distance between two subsequent waypoints is greater than MIS_DIST_WPS.

parameters.name: MIS_LTRMIN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will always obey. The intent is to stay out of ground effect. set to -1, if there shouldn't be a minimum loiter altitude

parameters.name: MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, yaw commands will be sent to the mount and the vehicle will follow its heading towards the flight direction. If disabled, the vehicle will yaw towards the ROI.

parameters.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will take off to.

parameters.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_REQ
parameters.longDesc: If set, the mission feasibility checker will check for a takeoff waypoint on the mission.

parameters.name: MIS_YAW_ERR
parameters.shortDesc: Max yaw error in degrees needed for waypoint heading acceptance

parameters.name: MIS_YAW_TMT
parameters.shortDesc: Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced
parameters.longDesc: If set > 0 it will ignore the target heading for normal waypoint acceptance. If the waypoint forces the heading the timeout will matter. For example on VTOL forwards transition. Mainly useful for VTOLs that have less yaw authority and might not reach target yaw in wind. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: MPC_YAW_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Specifies the heading in Auto.

parameters.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set. For fixed wing the L1 turning distance is used for horizontal acceptance.

parameters.name: NAV_DLL_ACT
parameters.shortDesc: Set data link loss failsafe mode
parameters.longDesc: The data link loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_DL_LOSS_T in seconds. Once the timeout occurs the selected action will be executed.

parameters.name: NAV_FORCE_VT
parameters.shortDesc: Force VTOL mode takeoff and land

parameters.name: NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD
parameters.shortDesc: FW Altitude Acceptance Radius before a landing
parameters.longDesc: Altitude acceptance used for the last waypoint before a fixed-wing landing. This is usually smaller than the standard vertical acceptance because close to the ground higher accuracy is required.

parameters.name: NAV_FW_ALT_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Acceptance radius for fixedwing altitude.

parameters.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, Hold mode, Return mode, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameters.name: NAV_MC_ALT_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Acceptance radius for multicopter altitude.

parameters.name: NAV_RCL_ACT
parameters.longDesc: The RC loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_RC_LOSS_T in seconds. If RC input checks have been disabled by setting the COM_RC_IN_MODE param it will not be triggered.

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_AVOID
parameters.longDesc: Enabling this will allow the system to respond to transponder data from e.g. ADSB transponders

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_RADM
parameters.shortDesc: Set NAV TRAFFIC AVOID RADIUS MANNED
parameters.longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Manned Aviation

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_RADU
parameters.longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Unmanned Aviation

parameters.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameters.longDesc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameters.name: MOT_ORDERING
parameters.longDesc: Determines the motor ordering. This can be used for example in combination with a 4-in-1 ESC that assumes a motor ordering which is different from PX4. ONLY supported for Quads. When changing this, make sure to test the motor response without props first.

parameters.name: MNT_DO_STAB
parameters.shortDesc:
Stabilize the mount (set to true for servo gimbal, false for passthrough).
Does not affect MAVLINK_ROI input

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control pitch (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control roll (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control yaw (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAV_COMPID
parameters.shortDesc: Mavlink Component ID of the mount
parameters.longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLINK, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this component ID.

parameters.name: MNT_MAV_SYSID
parameters.shortDesc: Mavlink System ID of the mount
parameters.longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLINK, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this target ID.

parameters.name: MNT_MODE_IN
parameters.longDesc: RC uses the AUX input channels (see MNT_MAN_* parameters), MAVLINK_ROI uses the MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI Mavlink message, and MAVLINK_DO_MOUNT the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL messages to control a mount.

parameters.name: MNT_MODE_OUT
parameters.longDesc: AUX uses the mixer output Control Group #2. MAVLINK uses the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL MavLink messages to control a mount (set MNT_MAV_SYSID & MNT_MAV_COMPID)

parameters.name: MNT_OB_LOCK_MODE
parameters.shortDesc:
Mixer value for selecting a locking mode
if required for the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_OB_NORM_MODE
parameters.shortDesc:
Mixer value for selecting normal mode
if required by the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for pitch channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for roll channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for yaw channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Range of pitch channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Range of roll channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Range of yaw channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit for pitch rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameters.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_RATT_TH
parameters.longDesc: Manual input needed in order to override attitude control rate setpoints and instead pass manual stick inputs as rate setpoints

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit for roll rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameters.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameters.longDesc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_YAW_P
parameters.longDesc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_YAW_WEIGHT
parameters.longDesc: A fraction [0,1] deprioritizing yaw compared to roll and pitch in non-linear attitude control. Deprioritizing yaw is necessary because multicopters have much less control authority in yaw compared to the other axes and it makes sense because yaw is not critical for stable hovering or 3D navigation. For yaw control tuning use MC_YAW_P. This ratio has no inpact on the yaw gain.

parameters.name: MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max yaw rate in auto mode
parameters.longDesc: Limit the rate of change of the yaw setpoint in autonomous mode to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameters.name: CP_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: CP_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameters.name: CP_GO_NO_DATA
parameters.shortDesc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: CP_GUIDE_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: MC_MAN_TILT_TAU
parameters.shortDesc:
Manual tilt input filter time constant
Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_DOWN_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes down

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_HOR
parameters.shortDesc: Acceleration for auto and for manual
parameters.longDesc: Note: In manual, this parameter is only used in MPC_POS_MODE 1.

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal acceleration for auto mode and for manual mode
parameters.longDesc: Maximum deceleration for MPC_POS_MODE 1. Maximum acceleration and deceleration for MPC_POS_MODE 3.

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_UP_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes upward

parameters.name: MPC_ALT_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Set to 0 to control height relative to the earth frame origin. This origin may move up and down in flight due to sensor drift. Set to 1 to control height relative to estimated distance to ground. The vehicle will move up and down with terrain height variation. Requires a distance to ground sensor. The height controller will revert to using height above origin if the distance to ground estimate becomes invalid as indicated by the local_position.distance_bottom_valid message being false. Set to 2 to control height relative to ground (requires a distance sensor) when stationary and relative to earth frame origin when moving horizontally. The speed threshold is controlled by the MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY parameter.

parameters.name: MPC_DEC_HOR_SLOW
parameters.shortDesc: Slow horizontal manual deceleration for manual mode
parameters.longDesc: Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to 1.

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_DZ
parameters.shortDesc: Deadzone of sticks where position hold is enabled

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameters.name: MPC_JERK_AUTO
parameters.longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility.

parameters.name: MPC_JERK_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility (how fast it can change directions or break). Setting this to the maximum value essentially disables the limit. Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to a smoothing mode 1 or 3.

parameters.name: MPC_JERK_MIN
parameters.longDesc: If this is not zero, a velocity-based maximum jerk limit is used: the applied jerk limit linearly increases with the vehicle's velocity between MPC_JERK_MIN (zero velocity) and MPC_JERK_MAX (maximum velocity). This means that the vehicle's motions are smooth for low velocities, but still allows fast direction changes or breaking at higher velocities. Set this to zero to use a fixed maximum jerk limit (MPC_JERK_MAX). Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to 1.

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_ALT1
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude for 1. step of slow landing (descend)
parameters.longDesc: Below this altitude: - descending velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_Z_VEL_MAX" and "MPC_LAND_SPEED" - horizontal velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_VEL_MANUAL" and "MPC_LAND_VEL_XY" for a smooth descent and landing experience. Value needs to be higher than "MPC_LAND_ALT2"

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_ALT2
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude for 2. step of slow landing (landing)
parameters.longDesc: Below this altitude descending and horizontal velocities get limited to "MPC_LAND_SPEED" and "MPC_LAND_VEL_XY", respectively. Value needs to be lower than "MPC_LAND_ALT1"

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_VEL_XY
parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum horizontal position mode velocity when close to ground/home altitude
Set the value higher than the otherwise expected maximum to disable any slowdown

parameters.name: MPC_MANTHR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. With MC_AIRMODE set to 1, this can safely be set to 0.

parameters.name: MPC_MAN_TILT_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximal tilt angle in manual or altitude mode

parameters.name: MPC_MAN_Y_TAU
parameters.shortDesc:
Manual yaw rate input filter time constant
Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameters.name: MPC_POS_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The supported sub-modes are: 0 Simple position control where sticks map directly to velocity setpoints without smoothing. Useful for velocity control tuning. 1 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits based on slew-rates. 3 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits based on jerk optimized trajectory generator (different algorithm than 1).

parameters.name: MPC_SPOOLUP_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Enforced delay between arming and takeoff
parameters.longDesc: For altitude controlled modes the time from arming the motors until a takeoff is possible gets forced to be at least MPC_SPOOLUP_TIME seconds to ensure the motors and propellers can sppol up and reach idle speed before getting commanded to spin faster. This delay is particularly useful for vehicles with slow motor spin-up e.g. because of large propellers.

parameters.name: MPC_THR_CURVE
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines how the throttle stick input is mapped to commanded thrust in Manual/Stabilized flight mode. In case the default is used ('Rescale to hover thrust'), the stick input is linearly rescaled, such that a centered stick corresponds to the hover throttle (see MPC_THR_HOVER). Select 'No Rescale' to directly map the stick 1:1 to the output. This can be useful in case the hover thrust is very low and the default would lead to too much distortion (e.g. if hover thrust is set to 20%, 80% of the upper thrust range is squeezed into the upper half of the stick range). Note: In case MPC_THR_HOVER is set to 50%, the modes 0 and 1 are the same.

parameters.name: MPC_THR_HOVER
parameters.longDesc: Vertical thrust required to hover. This value is mapped to center stick for manual throttle control. With this value set to the thrust required to hover, transition from manual to Altitude or Position mode while hovering will occur with the throttle stick near center, which is then interpreted as (near) zero demand for vertical speed. This parameter is also important for the landing detection to work correctly.

parameters.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
parameters.longDesc: Limit max allowed thrust

parameters.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum thrust in auto thrust control
parameters.longDesc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameters.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameters.longDesc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameters.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameters.longDesc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameters.name: MPC_TKO_RAMP_T
parameters.shortDesc: Position control smooth takeoff ramp time constant
parameters.longDesc: Increasing this value will make automatic and manual takeoff slower. If it's too slow the drone might scratch the ground and tip over. A time constant of 0 disables the ramp

parameters.name: MPC_USE_HTE
parameters.longDesc: Set false to use the fixed parameter MPC_THR_HOVER Set true to use the value computed by the hover thrust estimator

parameters.name: MPC_VELD_LP
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_VEL_MANUAL
parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum horizontal velocity setpoint for manual controlled mode
If velocity setpoint larger than MPC_XY_VEL_MAX is set, then
the setpoint will be capped to MPC_XY_VEL_MAX

parameters.name: MPC_XY_CRUISE
parameters.longDesc: Normal horizontal velocity in AUTO modes (includes also RTL / hold / etc.) and endpoint for position stabilized mode (POSCTRL).

parameters.name: MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual position control stick exponential curve sensitivity
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_XY_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameters.name: MPC_XY_TRAJ_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal trajectory position error

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non-zero value allows to eliminate steady state errors in the presence of disturbances like wind.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode. If higher speeds are commanded in a mission they will be capped to this velocity.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameters.name: MPC_YAW_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual control stick yaw rotation exponential curve
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual control stick vertical exponential curve
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_Z_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameters.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameters.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameters.longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Yaw
parameters.longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_P_MAX
parameters.shortDesc:
Max acro pitch rate
default: 2 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_R_MAX
parameters.shortDesc:
Max acro roll rate
default: 2 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameters.longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Yaw
parameters.longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameters.shortDesc:
Max acro yaw rate
default 1.5 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameters.longDesc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The copter should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max acceleration at lower battery percentages. i.e. if hover is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_PITCHRATE_K * (MC_PITCHRATE_P * error + MC_PITCHRATE_I * error_integral + MC_PITCHRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_PITCHRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_PITCHRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_PR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_ROLLRATE_K * (MC_ROLLRATE_P * error + MC_ROLLRATE_I * error_integral + MC_ROLLRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_ROLLRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_ROLLRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_RR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_YAWRATE_K * (MC_YAWRATE_P * error + MC_YAWRATE_I * error_integral + MC_YAWRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_YAWRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_YAWRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_YR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.

parameters.name: MOT_SLEW_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in maximum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameters.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameters.shortDesc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameters.longDesc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: PLD_BTOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time after which the landing target is considered lost without any new measurements.

parameters.name: PLD_FAPPR_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Allow final approach (without horizontal positioning) if losing landing target closer than this to the ground.

parameters.name: PLD_HACC_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Start descending if closer above landing target than this.

parameters.name: PLD_MAX_SRCH
parameters.longDesc: Maximum number of times to seach for the landing target if it is lost during the precision landing.

parameters.name: PLD_SRCH_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Altitude above home to which to climb when searching for the landing target.

parameters.name: PLD_SRCH_TOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time allowed to search for the landing target before falling back to normal landing.

parameters.name: RC_CHAN_CNT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.

parameters.name: RC_FAILS_THR
parameters.longDesc: Set to a value slightly above the PWM value assumed by throttle in a failsafe event, but ensure it is below the PWM value assumed by throttle during normal operation.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera roll

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameters.longDesc: The RC mapping index indicates which channel is used for failsafe If 0, whichever channel is mapped to throttle is used otherwise the value indicates the specific RC channel to use

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM1
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM2
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM3
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: TRIM_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: RC_ACRO_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_ARMSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_ASSIST_TH

parameters.name: RC_AUTO_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_GEAR_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_KILLSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_MAN_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ARM_SW
parameters.longDesc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FLTMODE
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameters.longDesc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_POSCTL_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RATT_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_STAB_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_TRANS_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RTL_CONE_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Half-angle of the return mode altitude cone
parameters.longDesc: Defines the half-angle of a cone centered around the destination position that affects the altitude at which the vehicle returns.

values.description: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above destination.
Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above destination.

parameters.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Descend to this altitude (above destination position) after return, and wait for time defined in RTL_LAND_DELAY. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed.

parameters.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Delay before landing (after initial descent) in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.

parameters.name: RTL_MIN_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal distance from return destination, below which RTL_DESCEND_ALT is used as return altitude
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle is less than this horizontal distance from the return destination when return mode is activated it will ascend to RTL_DESCEND_ALT for the return journey (rather than the altitude set by RTL_RETURN_ALT and RTL_CONE_ANG).

parameters.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Default minimum altitude above destination (e.g. home, safe point, landing pattern) for return flight. This is affected by RTL_MIN_DIST and RTL_CONE_ANG.

parameters.name: RTL_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Return mode destination and flight path (home location, rally point, mission landing pattern, reverse mission)

values.description: Return to closest safe point (home or rally point) via direct path.
Return to closest safe point other than home (mission landing pattern or rally point), via direct path. If no mission landing or rally points are defined return home via direct path.
Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path. Do not consider rally points.
Return via direct path to closest destination: home, start of mission landing pattern or safe point. If the destination is a mission landing pattern, follow the pattern to land.

parameters.name: RTL_PLD_MD
parameters.longDesc: Use precision landing when doing an RTL landing phase.

parameters.name: GND_L1_DAMPING
parameters.longDesc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameters.name: GND_L1_DIST
parameters.longDesc: This is the waypoint radius

parameters.name: GND_L1_PERIOD
parameters.longDesc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the rover it's following. Using values around 2-5 for a traxxas stampede. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameters.name: GND_MAX_ANG
parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum turn angle for Ackerman steering.
At a control output of 0, the steering wheels are at 0 radians.
At a control output of 1, the steering wheels are at GND_MAX_ANG radians

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_D
parameters.longDesc: This is the derivative gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_I
parameters.longDesc: This is the integral gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maxim value the integral can reach to prevent wind-up.

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_P
parameters.longDesc: This is the proportional gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_THR_SC
parameters.longDesc: This is a gain to map the speed control output to the throttle linearly.

parameters.name: GND_SP_CTRL_MODE
parameters.longDesc: This allows the user to choose between closed loop gps speed or open loop cruise throttle speed

values.description: close the loop with gps speed

parameters.name: GND_THR_CRUISE
parameters.longDesc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. 10% is ok for a traxxas stampede vxl with ESC set to training mode

parameters.name: GND_THR_IDLE
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground, it should be 0 for a rover

parameters.name: GND_THR_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For a Traxxas stampede vxl with the ESC set to training, 30 % is enough

parameters.name: GND_THR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. Set to 0 for rover

parameters.name: GND_WHEEL_BASE
parameters.shortDesc: Distance from front axle to rear axle

parameters.name: RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL
parameters.shortDesc:
Min. airspeed scaling factor for takeoff.
Pitch up will be commanded when the following airspeed is reached:
FW_AIRSPD_MIN * RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL

parameters.name: RWTO_HDG
parameters.shortDesc: Specifies which heading should be held during runnway takeoff
parameters.longDesc: 0: airframe heading, 1: heading towards takeoff waypoint

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc:
Max pitch during takeoff.
Fixed-wing settings are used if set to 0. Note that there is also a minimum
pitch of 10 degrees during takeoff, so this must be larger if set

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc:
Max roll during climbout.
Roll is limited during climbout to ensure enough lift and prevents aggressive
navigation before we're on a safe height

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_THR
parameters.shortDesc:
Max throttle during runway takeoff.
(Can be used to test taxi on runway)

parameters.name: RWTO_NAV_ALT
parameters.shortDesc:
Altitude AGL at which we have enough ground clearance to allow some roll.
Until RWTO_NAV_ALT is reached the plane is held level and only
rudder is used to keep the heading (see RWTO_HDG). This should be below
FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF if FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF > 0

parameters.name: RWTO_PSP
parameters.shortDesc:
Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff airspeed is reached.
A taildragger with stearable wheel might need to pitch up
a little to keep it's wheel on the ground before airspeed
to takeoff is reached

parameters.name: RWTO_RAMP_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Throttle ramp up time for runway takeoff

parameters.name: SDLOG_BOOT_BAT
parameters.longDesc: When enabled, logging will not start from boot if battery power is not detected (e.g. powered via USB on a test bench). This prevents extraneous flight logs from being created during bench testing. Note that this only applies to log-from-boot modes. This has no effect on arm-based modes.

parameters.name: SDLOG_DIRS_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
parameters.longDesc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.

parameters.name: SDLOG_MISSION
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).

parameters.name: SDLOG_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.

parameters.name: SDLOG_PROFILE
parameters.longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis and estimator replay, while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and Magnetomer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance 8 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Gyro) 9 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Accel)

parameters.name: SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET
parameters.longDesc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets

parameters.name: SDLOG_UUID
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle

parameters.name: SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT
parameters.shortDesc:
Simulator Battery minimal percentage. Can be used to alter
the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly.
Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour

parameters.name: CAL_MAG2_ROT
parameters.shortDesc: Rotation of magnetometer 2 relative to airframe
parameters.longDesc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG2_XCOMP
parameters.shortDesc:
Coefficient describing linear relationship between
X component of magnetometer in body frame axis
and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP
Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and
for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG2_YCOMP
parameters.shortDesc:
Coefficient describing linear relationship between
Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis
and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP
Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and
for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG2_ZCOMP
parameters.shortDesc:
Coefficient describing linear relationship between
Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis
and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP
Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and
for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG3_ID
parameters.shortDesc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameters.name: CAL_MAG3_ROT

parameters.longDesc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameters.longDesc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameters.longDesc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameters.shortDesc:
Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor.
Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and
control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground
is less than 50% of this value

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_CMODEL
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
parameters.longDesc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_TUBELEN
parameters.longDesc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG_ROT_AUTO
parameters.longDesc: During calibration attempt to automatically determine the rotation of external magnetometers.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG_SIDES
parameters.shortDesc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
parameters.longDesc: If set to two side calibration, only the offsets are estimated, the scale calibration is left unchanged. Thus an initial six side calibration is recommended. Bits: ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32

parameters.name: IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for accel
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary accelerometer. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Cutoff frequency for angular acceleration (D-Term filter)
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter used on the time derivative of the measured angular velocity, also known as the D-term filter in the rate controller. The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to increase IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for gyro
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary gyro. This only affects the angular velocity sent to the controllers, not the estimators. It applies also to the angular acceleration (D-Term filter), see IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF_BW
parameters.longDesc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ
parameters.longDesc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Gyro control data maximum publication rate
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum rate the gyro control data (sensor_gyro) will be allowed to publish at. Set to 0 to disable and publish at the native sensor sample rate.

parameters.name: IMU_INTEG_RATE
parameters.longDesc: The rate at which raw IMU data is integrated to produce delta angles and delta velocities. Recommended to set this to a multiple of the estimator update period (currently 10 ms for ekf2).

parameters.name: SENS_BARO_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Barometric air data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual barometric data rate is still dependant on the sensor.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB
parameters.longDesc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the PX4FLOW board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle. The recommneded installation default for the PX4FLOW board is with the Y axis forward (270 deg yaw).

parameters.name: SENS_GPS_MASK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameters.name: SENS_GPS_TAU
parameters.longDesc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameters.name: SENS_MAG_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Magnetometer data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual magnetometer data rate is still dependant on the sensor.

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameters.longDesc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameters.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameters.shortDesc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameters.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameters.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameters.longDesc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HITL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameters.longDesc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameters.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameters.longDesc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameters.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameters.longDesc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters from the airframe configuration are reloaded.

parameters.name: SYS_RESTART_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Set by px4io to indicate type of restart
